text:
Liisamaija Laaksonen-Kaitue (born 6 May 1938) is a Finnish actress. She wrote several television shows in the 1990s and 2000s. Laaksonen was born in Lahti, Finland. She was known for her roles in Helsinki Theatre Academy from 1960 to 1963 and worked as a regular actress of Yle 1963 to 1998.
Laaksonen was known for her roles in "Black on White" (1968), "The Glory and Misery of Human Life" (1989), and "Kaivo" (1992).

annotations.surface_form: The Glory and Misery of Human Life
